properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 9 at 10:47PM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW FRIDAY...

.A potent winter storm will move into the Inland Northwest
Friday. Light snow will begin in the morning hours on Friday with
snow intensity increasing Friday afternoon and night.  Snow showers
will linger through Saturday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5
inches along Highway 97.  Amounts of 5 to 7 inches possible
along Highway 155 near Disautel and Nespelem.

* WHERE...Omak, Okanogan, Brewster, Bridgeport, Oroville,
Nespelem, and Disautel Pass.

* WHEN...From 4 AM to 4 PM PST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST FRIDAY
